bibl.title: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, November 5, 1951

div1.p: Blossom Reed explains why Hench is receiving numerous requests for information about her father: she mentioned in an interview Hench's extensive collection of Reed material.

div1.head: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, November 5, 1951
div1.opener:
Nov 5 - 1951 -
MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
Dear Dr- Hench-
div1.p:
I feel that I
am a little to
blame for all the
letters you are
receiving etc - about
Walter Reed - and
I'll now try to
make it clear-
Before the 100th
anniversary of my
beloved father's birth,
the newspapers about
ran me ragged-
One man, by phone,
wanted to know
what we had
done with father's
letters - etc - and
like a “Smarty” I said,
my wonderful friend
Dr- Hench has
them in perfect keeping-
That was put in
MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
not worded like that
of course-

All the papers- Its
funny how they hang
on every word- I
can't tell you the
letters I had after
my trip to Gloucester-
Now - Brother may
answer you at
once - and he may not
you - who have
been so wonderful
about it all - and
I feel like you are
one of the Reed
family- I think its
up to you to do
what you want
to - and I think
entry “The Reed family
and Dr- P- S- Hench”
would be fine! or
“The Reed family through
Dr- P- S- Hench”- You
be the boss - and if
you don't hear from
the Gen. I know he would
approve of any thing I say-
With best wishes
